page.title: 05FIRE STATION,ANNAN
page.content: The fire station in Standalane was built in 1983 to replace the old one in Port Street.This station serves Annan & District and is used as a back-up service to Dumfries.The station has two appliances.The firemen are all part-time and have day jobs in or near Annan.There are 17 men altogether. When there is a fire they are summoned to the station by means of a pocket alerter.In past days a siren was set off. Recently the call out system was changed.If there is a small fire only half of the men are called out.If it is a fire which needs all of the firemen the other half of the men are called out 30 seconds later.This saves all of the men being called out only for some of them to be sent away.
